title: The Kenyan café that helps fight discrimination against deaf people
description: Most waiters at one Kenyan café are deaf, so customers use sign language, mimes or gestures.

title: Ukraine war: Rescuing vulnerable children from the front line
description: A BBC crew follows an ambulance team as medics evacuate 12 children from the city of Sumy.

title: Breast cancer: 'The moment I saw my new nipple tattoos'
description: Emily, from Nottingham, received the tattoos following surgery for breast cancer.

title: Minecraft used in school to tackle flooding
description: The Environment Agency is teaming up with school pupils to help tackle problem flooding in the UK.

title: Does it matter if we know where our food comes from?
description: Increasingly sophisticated tech tells us more than ever about our food's journey from farm to fork.

title: Ukraine round-up: Evidence of alleged Russian atrocities mounts near Kyiv
description: New evidence of alleged Russian atrocities near Kyiv emerges on Day 40 of the Russian invasion.

title: Head of village near Bucha killed with family in Ukraine
description: The BBC sees further evidence of alleged atrocities in areas recently occupied by Russia.

title: Curious owl inspects TV weather station camera
description: The camera in Great Falls, Montana, captured the moment the bird peeked into its lens.

title: John Travolta poses for photos in Norfolk Morrisons and Wetherspoon
description: The Hollywood star is filming a short movie in Norfolk and is seen out and about in the local area.

title: Big Brother star Glyn Wise plans to be priest
description: The runner up of series seven of Big Brother says he has swapped reality TV for the church.

title: Ukraine war: Ukraine investigates alleged execution of civilians by Russians
description: Bucha, Irpin and more - this is where civilians' bodies have been found scattered around as Russian troops pulled out.

title: Ian Woosnam: 'You work all your life for a putt to win the Masters'
description: In 1991 Ian Woosnam continued the line of British champions at the Masters by winning on 11 under par. Here he describes how he played the final hole.

title: June Brown's 10 best EastEnders moments as Dot
description: As the EastEnders legend says she has left Walford for good, look back at her most memorable moments.

title: Obituary: June Brown, Albert Square's Dot Cotton
description: June Brown played one of EastEnders best loved characters, Dot Cotton.

title: Ukrainian girl Amelia, 7, wows audiences in Welsh choir contest
description: Amelia, famous for singing Let It Go in a bomb shelter, sang the Ukrainian national anthem in Aberystwyth.

title: Kinder Surprise eggs recalled over salmonella link
description: Some food poisoning cases in children have been linked to the chocolate eggs, the Food Standards Agency says.

title: Boris Johnson given wrong information on lockdown parties, says Jacob Rees-Mogg
description: The minister says Boris Johnson had not deliberately attempted to mislead on whether lockdown rules were broken.

title: Liverpool: Why Championship success is just the start for women's team
description: Liverpool have returned to the top flight of women's football following their Championship title win, and are already planning for next season in the WSL.

title: Elon Musk snaps up $3bn Twitter stake
description: Tesla founder Elon Musk has bought almost a tenth of Twitter shares, worth almost $3bn.

title: Covid: Young child development worrying, says Ofsted boss
description: Some babies have limited vocabularies and struggle to understand facial expressions, a report finds.

title: Covid: Nine new symptoms added to official list
description: Sore throats, headaches and loss of appetite are now all officially recognised as signs of infection.

title: Easter travel disruption as flights cancelled
description: Airlines cancel scores of flights due to Covid as UK airports struggle and Eurotunnel warns of three hour delays.

title: North Devon first in UK to become World Surfing Reserve
description: North Devon is named a World Surfing Reserve alongside Malibu and Santa Cruz in California.

title: Hungary election: PM Viktor Orban criticises Ukraine's Zelensky as he wins vote
description: Near-complete results show Viktor Orban has won a fourth term in Hungary's election by a landslide.

title: Cricket World Cup: England's defeat by Australia should be 'slap in the face'
description: Australia are not likely to get worse after winning the Women's World Cup. England must get better to match them, writes Stephan Shemilt.

title: Stamp price rises: First class postage is now 95p
description: Royal Mail says it will help cover rising delivery costs, but some have criticised the 11% hike.

title: Grammy Awards 2022: Five stand-out moments
description: From almost kisses to near trophy misses, here's five of the best from Sunday's Grammys ceremony.

title: Met Police officer charged with sexual assault of colleague
description: The assault is alleged to have happened when he was a student officer at Hendon Training School.

title: Iga Swiatek on Ashleigh Barty, tears and becoming world number one
description: Iga Swiatek talks about replacing Ashleigh Barty at the top of the world rankings and the dominance which has brought her three straight titles.

title: Victory for Hungary's Orban means a headache for the EU
description: EU hearts will sink as "illiberal democrat" Viktor Orban wins another term, Katya Adler writes.

title: Ellie Simmonds: A World Without Dwarfism - Paralympian explores views on new drug
description: In new BBC documentary, Ellie Simmonds: A World Without Dwarfism, the Paralympic athlete explores a controversial new drug for children with achondroplasia.

title: Grammy honours go to Olivia Rodrigo, Silk Sonic and Jon Batiste
description: Jon Batiste wins album of the year while Silk Sonic's Leave The Door Open is named song of the year.

title: Grammys 2022: Ukraine president delivers powerful speech
description: "Our musicians wear armour not tuxedos," Volodymyr Zelensky tells the star-studded Grammys audience.

title: Bondi Beach: Huge tides engulf Sydney's famous beach
description: Scenes of swells washing over Australia's most famous beach and its promenade have stunned locals.

title: Gynaecology waits soar by 60% during pandemic
description: Waiting lists for gynaecological conditions have risen more sharply than any other specialty.

title: How TikTok is forcing singers to search for a viral moment
description: As TikTok continues to shape the music industry, singers discuss the app's impact on their careers.

title: Texas abortion: The ‘ranch’ for mothers with no place to go
description: Women have few options in Texas, since the passing of one of the strictest abortion laws in the US.

title: Trump's Truth Social app branded a disaster
description: Donald Trump's social media platform was supposed to be "fully operational" by the end of March.

title: Mansiya VP: Kerala dancer who took on religious conservatives
description: Dancer Mansiya VP, born a Muslim, says art has no religion after a temple refused to let her perform.

title: Escape from Mariupol: 'My little son hides bread'
description: For those escaping besieged Mariupol, the suffering is far from over, especially for their children.
